text: hello my needle drops Anthony Fantino
here Internet's busiest music nerve I'm
a little sick still still but I'm on the
mend I'm getting better I feel more
energy I feel more appetite you know
really the only thing that I feel like
is holding me back man is this stuffy
nose before I get into this review I
want to thank everybody who's been
commenting and everything saying get
better get well feel better feel well
it's flattering to know that I'm in your
thoughts and thank you let's start this
thing this album is from a bro named
Luke Abbott Abbott is an electronic
musician from the UK and he's got a lot
of singles and EPS under his belt but as
far as i know this is his first proper
full-length album holcomb drones now
don't judge a book by it's cover or an
album by its title because holcomb
drones is not just this weird
psychedelic Spacey drone odyssey
disappointing I know instead this thing
is actually an incredibly fun listen
over an hour of material that kind of
genre hops like mad this thing just
keeps me on the edge of my seat and just
kind of keeps me curious keeps me
engaged and that's mostly because of all
the twists and turns Luke Abbott takes
over the course of this album this thing
starts off with an extremely extremely
slow tempo this fuddy-duddy old-school
drum machine that sounds like something
out of beach houses devotion and warm
analog synths as well just bubbling
bubbling arpeggiated chords and it all
sounds like some kind of lost
synthesizer expedition from the 70s
something that I'm sure maybe vangelis
or definitely the guys in craft work
would get teary-eyed to to go back to
the percussion it really adds to the
vintage aesthetic of this album too
you've got these clicks that sound
something like snares you have really
bouncy
base hits and the symbols are kind of
what get me the most they don't really
sound like symbols as much as they sound
like little hissing snakes crawling all
over the mix I don't want to say this
but I can't help but feel it it just
sounds cute the drums actually remind me
of some sounds I would be hearing a lot
when I was a kid sitting indian-style
and from the TV and playing an
infuriating game of balloon fight but I
wouldn't mind playing a game of Metroid
to this thing either and it's not hard
to see why many of these tracks are
based on repetitive layered melodies
that are hypnotic and soft and don't
adhere to structure or time constraints
very explorative stuff I haven't heard
synth worship modern synth worship like
this since Matt Moses supreme balloon
and I absolutely adore that album but to
go back to the genre hopping that I
mentioned earlier there are other sides
of this album this isn't just some kind
of one-dimensional thing there are
tracks on here that feel inspired by the
earliest days of house music something
that the DFA Crowder LCD soundsystem
fans might go nuts for and there are
tracks on here that really dabbled in
minimal techno despite that the since
still sound kind of old-school the drums
still sound kind of old-school the music
really grabbed me in a pantha du prince
kind of way and of course there are
songs and moments that basically
straddle these musical ideas as well
incorporating bits of one bits of the
other really the only thing one hundred
percent cohesive about holcomb drones is
just its devotion to these vintage
sounds but this music is still executed
with a very contemporary ear and when it
does get it weird it does get
experimental it doesn't sound like you
know old outdated archaic
experimentations it sounds like an
adventure of today if you're open minded
I could see this thing appealing to a
lot of different fans of electronic
music and for me it works on multiple
levels of listening you could be paying
complete attention to this and still get
a lot out of it still see a lot of
subtlety here and still pull a lot of
secrets out of this thing really dive
into the nooks and crannies
and then again it sounds really nice in
the background is just kind of chill out
music just mood setting music my only
real gripe is that maybe on several
spots of this album to me it meanders a
little bit it would have been really
awesome if there were some more of those
dance tracks on here which initially are
what kind of caught me and made me want
to stick with the LP and really explore
it more and more and to me even though
everything else the slower moments
really have grown on me these dancey or
tracks really are the showstoppers of
this album right now on this thing and
pretty much feeling a decent eight I
really enjoyed the hell out of this
thing and want to listen to it more i'm
going to add it to the love list which
is linked in the d box and give it a
listen let me know what you think are
you loving it hating it and why and how
does this thing measure up compared to
the other electronic albums of this year
that you've been enjoying hmm Anthony
Fantana Luke Abbott holcomb drones
